page.title: 12Acklington First School
page.content: The school, opened in{1853,}is one of the oldest in the county. It is small but, according to headteacher Mr John Davison,"bright, busy, friendly and an effective unit where pupils are happy and well motivated to learn". There are 32{pupils}(aged 4-9) on roll at present. Most live on the Home Office Estate and a few are bussed to school from the Guyzance area. The 6 members of{staff}are:{Headteacher}Mr Davison, {Assistant Teacher}Mrs A. Simpson,{Cook Mrs G. Williamson,{Caretaker}Mrs V. Taylor,{Secretary}Mrs J.Davison and {Supervisory Assistant}Mrs J.Mitchell. All staff live in the village with the exception of Mrs Simpson who lives in Alnwick. The{school day}is from 9 a.m. to 3.30 p.m. and{lessons}taught include: English, Maths, Science, Art & Craft, R.E., Music, Environmental Studies, Drama, P.E. and Swimming.
